CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 30, 1954, pg. 1, reads: "Attend Funeral - Nurses for St. John Hospital, where Miss Marion Hart, 19, formerly of 9 Kearney Way, is a student, attended the funeral of Miss Hart's brother and two nieces Monday at Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church. The youngsters were victims of the gas-blast fire which killed four and injured three last week at the aforementioned address.  The tragedy shocked the Hill District. - Harris Photo."  Portions of article read: "...three children who lost their lives in a searing, gas-fed fire at 9 Kearney Way shortly after midnight last Wednesday.  Four others were injured in same holocaust, two of them critically....And early Wednesday morning, Fate decreed that one of those critically injured should join the trio in their Eternal Home.  Mrs. Lomie Hart, 50, who was the mother, grandmother and aunt of the youngsters, died in Mercy Hospital as a result of the third-degree burns suffered in the same fire.  Last rites were held at Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church, with the Rev. Harold R. Tolliver in charge.  He was assisted by the Rev. Charles H. Foggie of Wesley Center AME Zion Church..."
TitMainTitle: Women holding flowers and lined up on sidewalk, with Rev. Charles Foggie standing behind opened door of car with Pennsylvania license plate "9ZP6", possibly for funeral of fire victims Clarence Gary Hart, Phyllis Chambers, and Terry English
